column5: does the liquid in gulp alive freeze if so when does it freeze i want to buy some and that is a big question i have had about it

the baits themselves will freeze yes so i would assume the same for the tub of liquid   from another site The freezing point is in the mid 20s degree F. It will not hurt the physical integrity of the baits to freeze and thaw. Having said that it is still not a good practice to have the baits go through repeated freeze/thaws over and over again. As for the container we did repeated freeze thaw testing on an upright bucket with no failures, but if this bucket is left on it's side when frozen it may rupture the seal and leak.
Just buy it Rob, if you do you will actually start catching fish     On a serious note if you take care of it you shouldn't have to worry about it freezing.......
but can you mix your Gulp with your Gulp Alive or are those 2 different scents?

Robert,  I used Gulp fish fry a lot last hard water season and the juice in the little jars, I found would turn to slush and would not affect it's effectiveness..... I also found that it turns to slush faster if the lid is left open.   I usually carry those jars in my big white pale so that it's not left directly on top of the ice.  Once I use the last piece in the jar, I keep the juice for refilling other.... the lids do leak a little so I recommend not carrying the jars in your coat pockets  Jacques
thanks for the help i just didnt want to buy the big jar and have it ruined on me
You can buy the big jar, just buy a small sealing jar (like a baby food jar) to go with it.  Then you can bring along as much as you want to.
I mix everything with the gulp juice  Try this Half a lime 1 shot gulp alive 1 shot your favorite booze  Let me know
it tastes like burning.... good thing its biodegradable though... i ate the worm...
